seo.title_override: Austin TX Mattress Disposal Guide 2026: Easy & Legal
seo.meta_desc_override: Navigating Austin TX mattress disposal? Avoid a Class B misdemeanor and fines up to $2,000. Discover rules for legal curbside pickup & eco-friendly options.

hero_hook: Don't let an old mattress become a $2,000 problem in Austin – learn the easy way to dispose of it legally.
neighborhoods: South Congress, Zilker, Bouldin Creek, Travis Heights, Clarksville, Hyde Park, East Austin, Mueller, Allandale, Crestview, Tarrytown, Barton Hills, Cherrywood, North Loop, Downtown Austin

curbside_rules.placement_time: by 5:30 a.m. on your appointment date.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Appointments are required for collection — items will not be picked up without one. Keep items 5 feet away from your carts, mailbox, fences or walls, water meter, telephone connection box, fire hydrants and parked cars. Do not place any items under low-hanging tree limbs or power lines. Items will not be collected if they are in an alley, in front of a vacant lot, or in front of a business. Do not put items in bags, boxes or other containers. Bags will be treated as extra trash and may incur additional trash fees. Bulk collection is only for residential customers and homes in certain Limited Districts. Brush collection is only for residential customers, homes in certain Limited Districts and Emergency Services Districts (ESD). Items not accepted for bulk collection include: Automotive chassis and bodies, Boats, Brush, Cardboard boxes, Carpet (from construction/demolition), Hazardous materials, Household trash, Mirrors, Motorcycles, Sheet glass and other construction and remodeling debris, Tile (whole or broken), Tires that are still mounted

hero_hook: Can't carry it down five flights of stairs?
neighborhoods: Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx, Staten Island, Williamsburg, Astoria, Park Slope, Upper West Side, Upper East Side, Chelsea, SoHo, Harlem, Long Island City, Flushing

contacts.department_name: New York City Department of Sanitation

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: You must enclose mattresses and box springs in a sealed plastic bag to protect DSNY workers from bed bugs. Mattresses and box springs that are not in bags will not be collected.
curbside_rules.placement_time: Place items out for collection after 4 PM the day before your collection day.
curbside_rules.size_limits: No specific size or weight limits mentioned for mattresses beyond general bulk item guidelines.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Must be sealed in a plastic bag to prevent bedbugs or it will NOT be collected

donation_policy: Most NYC charities (Salvation Army, Goodwill, Housing Works) do not accept used mattresses due to strict hygiene laws and bed bug prevention policies.

illegal_dumping.fine_amount: Not less than $400 nor more than $4,000 for a first offense
illegal_dumping.citation: Rules of the City of New York Title 16, Chapter 1, Section 1-04 (l), referencing NYC Administrative Code §16-119.

hero_hook: Tired of waiting weeks for city pickup?
neighborhoods: Hollywood, Santa Monica, Venice, Downtown LA, Silver Lake, Echo Park, West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Culver City, Pasadena, Glendale, Burbank, Long Beach, Koreatown, Los Feliz

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: Residents are entitled to a FREE Bulky Item pick-up service for items too large to fit in your bins, such as mattresses, furniture, or appliances.
curbside_rules.placement_time: Items can be placed at the curb no earlier than 12 hours prior to your scheduled collection day and no later than 6:00 AM on your collection day.
curbside_rules.size_limits: Items too large to fit in your bins (no specific dimension or weight limits stated beyond this).
curbside_rules.the_catch: Must schedule appointment in advance and wait for your designated pickup day

donation_policy: Most Los Angeles charities (Salvation Army, Goodwill) generally decline used mattresses due to California hygiene laws and liability concerns.

illegal_dumping.citation: Los Angeles Municipal Code Sections 66.25 and 66.32; Los Angeles City Administrative Code Section 22.12.1(a)

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: Bulk items, such as furniture, mattresses, and appliances, are picked up on your regularly scheduled garbage collection day.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Must be placed out on your specific garbage day, not recycling day, or it won't be collected

donation_policy: Most Chicago charities (Salvation Army, Goodwill) do not accept used mattresses due to hygiene regulations and bed bug concerns.

curbside_rules.size_limits: Items too large to fit in your green cart.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Collection only happens during your designated junk waste week, which varies by neighborhood

curbside_rules.placement_time: Place bulk trash at the curb no earlier than eight days prior to your collection week and no later than Sunday evening before collection week.
curbside_rules.size_limits: Bulk trash piles must be no larger than 20 feet long, 6 feet wide and 4 feet high.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Bulk collection only happens during your designated collection week, which varies by neighborhood

seo.title_override: San Diego Mattress Disposal & Recycling Guide 2026
seo.meta_desc_override: Navigate San Diego mattress disposal rules and avoid a $1,000 fine. Learn about recycling options and check city guidelines for curbside pickup.

hero_hook: Disposing of an old mattress in San Diego can be a costly headache if not done right.
neighborhoods: Pacific Beach, La Jolla, North Park, South Park, Hillcrest, Little Italy, Gaslamp Quarter, Mission Beach, Ocean Beach, Point Loma, Old Town, Mira Mesa, Carmel Valley, Rancho Bernardo, University City

drop_off_locations.name: The Mattress Collection Site
drop_off_locations.hours: Monday to Friday from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. The site is closed on Saturdays and Sundays.
drop_off_locations.tipping_fee: Free for mattresses and box springs. Landfill fees may apply if your mattresses are brought in with other waste.
drop_off_locations.notes: Accepts mattresses, box springs, and futon mattresses (must be removed from frame or base). Items must not be severely damaged, wet, twisted, frozen, soiled or infested with bedbugs. No drop-off limit. The site is CLOSED on the following holidays: New Year's Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day. Does not accept mattress pads or toppers, sleeping bags and cots, pillows, cushions, blankets, sheets and other loose bedding, car beds, infant carriers, lounge pads or crib bumpers, juvenile products (carriages, baskets, cribs, crib mattresses, bassinets, dressing tables, dressing table pads, strollers and playpens, crib bumpers or their pads), waterbeds, collapsible rollaway beds, camping air mattresses, foldout sofa beds, futon frames/bases, or household furniture. Mattresses or box springs in a cardboard box or plastic bag are not accepted.

competitor_comparison.value_prop: No franchise fees. Just local haulers.

hero_hook: Don't want to wait for your bulk collection day?
neighborhoods: Uptown, Downtown, Deep Ellum, Bishop Arts, Highland Park, University Park, Lakewood, Oak Lawn, Preston Hollow, Knox-Henderson, Lower Greenville, M Streets, Plano, Frisco, Richardson

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: Mattresses fall under general bulk waste rules. Items that are heavier than 150 pounds or larger than 8 feet will not be collected by the City of Dallas Bulk & Brush Collection.
curbside_rules.placement_time: Place your bulk waste neatly at the curb by 7:00 a.m. on your collection day. Bulk waste must not be placed out more than seven days prior to your collection day.
curbside_rules.size_limits: All items must be less than 8 feet long and weigh no more than 150 lbs.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Items over 150 lbs or 8 feet will NOT be collected - you must haul them yourself

drop_off_locations.name: Northwest Transfer Station
drop_off_locations.notes: Proof of Dallas residency required, accepts mattresses and bulk waste.

drop_off_locations.name: South Central Transfer Station
drop_off_locations.notes: Proof of Dallas residency required, accepts mattresses and bulk waste.

drop_off_locations.name: Bachman Neighborhood Depository
drop_off_locations.notes: Proof of Dallas residency required, accepts mattresses and bulk waste.

drop_off_locations.name: McCommas Bluff Landfill
drop_off_locations.notes: Fees apply, proof of Dallas residency may be required for residential rates, accepts mattresses and general waste.

donation_policy: Most Dallas charities (Salvation Army, Goodwill) do not accept used mattresses due to Texas hygiene laws and bed bug concerns.

illegal_dumping.citation: City of Dallas Sanitation Services: Illegal Dumping (Class C Misdemeanor)

seo.title_override: Seattle Mattress Disposal Guide 2026: Easy & Eco-Friendly
seo.meta_desc_override: Seattle mattress disposal made easy! Avoid fines up to $5,000 with our 2026 guide. Learn about convenient curbside pickup options & eco-friendly recycling.

hero_hook: Don't let Seattle's notorious rain make disposing of your old mattress a soggy, heavy burden.
neighborhoods: Ballard, Capitol Hill, Queen Anne, Fremont, West Seattle, Columbia City, Wallingford, Greenwood, Ravenna, University District, Belltown, Downtown, South Lake Union, Beacon Hill, Madrona

curbside_rules.placement_time: On collection day, set out special items where you would normally have your solid waste service collected. Items must be out at the collection point by 7:00 a.m. on that collection day.
curbside_rules.the_catch: The utility account holder must make the request. The person(s) responsible for the combined utility bill must be able to authorize charges on the account. Costs vary by the type of item collected. For safety reasons, please remove any refrigerator and freezer doors that have latches. Items made of absorbent material must have a waterproof cover on rainy days. Items placed outside must be on a flat, level surface (no stairs) and easily accessible from the street. If the normal solid waste location is a secured area, please place the bulky item outside.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Schedule a special item pickup To request the collection of large or hard to dispose of items at your home, schedule online or call Seattle Public Utilities Customer Service at (206) 684-3000. Special items will be collected on the next regular garbage collection day, after the pickup has been scheduled. UDP customers that live in a single-family home and receive a Seattle Public Utilities bill in their name can get two free special item pickups per year when calling for collection.

weather_profile.rejection_risk_copy: WARNING: Seattle averages 100+ rainy days per year. If your mattress gets wet before pickup, the city WILL NOT take it (too heavy, mold risk). Our haulers pick up from inside your home — rain or shine.
